intro: Pertusadina hainanensis, commonly known as Hainan pertusary, is a rare flowering plant native to the Hainan Island in China. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, white or greenish flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as mountain forests, where it thrives in cool, humid conditions. Its unique morphology and limited distribution make it an important subject for botanical research and conservation efforts.
